meanings.definition: An indirect or subtle suggestion or hint.
meanings.sent1: Her insinuation that he was lying made him feel uneasy.
meanings.sent2: The insinuation in her tone implied that she knew more than she was letting on.
meanings.sent3: The insinuation that the cat had eaten the last piece of cake was met with laughter.
meanings.sent4: His insinuation that life was a puzzle to be solved resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent5: The insinuation of danger in the dark alley sent shivers down her spine.

meanings.definition: The act of suggesting or hinting at something indirectly.
meanings.sent1: His insinuation of a surprise party was met with excitement.
meanings.sent2: The insinuation of a promotion in her boss's email made her day.
meanings.sent3: The insinuation of a secret mission had everyone intrigued.
meanings.sent4: The insinuation of a hidden treasure sparked a frenzy of activity.
meanings.sent5: The insinuation of a ghost in the old house sent chills down their spines.
